metadata.title: CVE-2022-23181 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The fix for bug CVE-2020-9484 introduced a time of check, time of usevulnerability into Apache Tomcat 10.1.0-M1 to 10.1.0-M8, 10.0.0-M5 to10.0.14, 9.0.35 to 9.0.56 and 8.5.55 to 8.5.73 that allowed a localattacker to perform actions with the privileges of the user that the Tomcatprocess is using. This issue is only exploitable when Tomcat is configuredto persist sessions using the FileStore.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23181` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13+esm1
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13+esm1
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13+esm1
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13+esm1
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13+esm1
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13+esm1
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tomcat8 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13+esm1').
